articles.title: Video: Mom says son chose extremist group over her - CNN Video
articles.description: Karen Amsden, whose son is an accused Patriot Front member, tells CNN's Sara Sidner how she wants to win her son back from extremism, and a psychiatrist offers advice for what friends and families in similar situations can do.

articles.author: Pierre Meilhan, CNN
articles.title: Several people shot at Copenhagen mall, police say
articles.description: Several people have been shot at a mall in Copenhagen, according to Danish police.

articles.author: Ivana Kottasová, Yulia Kesaieva, Hannah Ritchie, Mariya Knight, Radina Gigova and Jonny Hallam, CNN
articles.title: Ukrainian forces withdraw from Lysychansk, their last holdout in key region
articles.description: Russia has taken control of Lysychansk, the last city in the Luhansk region in eastern Ukraine that was still under Ukrainian control.

articles.author: Sara Sidner, CNN
articles.title: Mom agonizes about how to reach her son, a man with a Buddha tattoo who turned to hate
articles.description: Her grown son told her he was going camping. Then he was arrested with accused Patriot Front extremists near an Idaho Pride event. It was a turning point for Karen Amsden, who fears her grandchildren are being indoctrinated.
articles.content:
If we expect them to ever come out of the proverbial rabbit hole, we have to understand what brought them in in the first place
Joseph Ma Pierre

articles.author: Kevin Liptak
articles.title: Cheney says January 6 committee could make multiple criminal referrals, including of Trump
articles.description: The House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection could make multiple criminal referrals, including of former President Donald Trump, the panel's vice chair, Rep. Liz Cheney, said in an interview broadcast Sunday.

articles.author: John Blake, CNN
articles.title: Racism is still a big problem in the US, but this trend offers some hope
articles.description: Some 94% of Americans now approve of interracial marriage -- a dramatic shift from the era of the civil rights movement. But why is interracial marriage so accepted when other issues of race, like affirmative action and integration, remain fiercely contested?
articles.content:
By John Blake, CNN
Updated 8:56 AM ET, Sun July 3, 2022
